description: Changes information about a Stage resource.

parameters.name: restApiId
parameters.description: The string identifier of the associated RestApi.

parameters.name: stageName
parameters.description: The name of the Stage resource to change information about.

parameters.name: patchOperations
parameters.description: For more information about supported patch operations, see Patch Operations. (dict) --- For more information about supported patch operations, see Patch Operations. op (string) --- An update operation to be performed with this PATCH request. The valid value can be add, remove, replace or copy. Not all valid operations are supported for a given resource. Support of the operations depends on specific operational contexts. Attempts to apply an unsupported operation on a resource will return an error message.. path (string) --- The op operation's target, as identified by a JSON Pointer value that references a location within the targeted resource. For example, if the target resource has an updateable property of {'name':'value'}, the path for this property is /name. If the name property value is a JSON object (e.g., {'name': {'child/name': 'child-value'}}), the path for the child/name property will be /name/child~1name. Any slash ('/') character appearing in path names must be escaped with '~1', as shown in the example above. Each op operation can have only one path associated with it. value (string) --- The new target value of the update operation. It is applicable for the add or replace operation. When using AWS CLI to update a property of a JSON value, enclose the JSON object with a pair of single quotes in a Linux shell, e.g., --{'a': --¦}'. from (string) --- The copy update operation's source as identified by a JSON-Pointer value referencing the location within the targeted resource to copy the value from. For example, to promote a canary deployment, you copy the canary deployment ID to the affiliated deployment ID by calling a PATCH request on a Stage resource with 'op':'copy', 'from':'/canarySettings/deploymentId' and 'path':'/deploymentId'.

nested_params.name: op
nested_params.description: An update operation to be performed with this PATCH request. The valid value can be add, remove, replace or copy. Not all valid operations are supported for a given resource. Support of the operations depends on specific operational contexts. Attempts to apply an unsupported operation on a resource will return an error message..

nested_params.name: path
nested_params.description: The op operation's target, as identified by a JSON Pointer value that references a location within the targeted resource. For example, if the target resource has an updateable property of {'name':'value'}, the path for this property is /name. If the name property value is a JSON object (e.g., {'name': {'child/name': 'child-value'}}), the path for the child/name property will be /name/child~1name. Any slash ('/') character appearing in path names must be escaped with '~1', as shown in the example above. Each op operation can have only one path associated with it.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The new target value of the update operation. It is applicable for the add or replace operation. When using AWS CLI to update a property of a JSON value, enclose the JSON object with a pair of single quotes in a Linux shell, e.g., --{'a': --¦}'.

nested_params.name: from
nested_params.description: The copy update operation's source as identified by a JSON-Pointer value referencing the location within the targeted resource to copy the value from. For example, to promote a canary deployment, you copy the canary deployment ID to the affiliated deployment ID by calling a PATCH request on a Stage resource with 'op':'copy', 'from':'/canarySettings/deploymentId' and 'path':'/deploymentId'.

nested_items.name: deploymentId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Deployment that the stage points to.

nested_items.name: clientCertificateId
nested_items.description: The identifier of a client certificate for an API stage.

nested_items.name: stageName
nested_items.description: The name of the stage is the first path segment in the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a call to API Gateway. Stage names can only contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores. Maximum length is 128 characters.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The stage's description.

nested_items.name: cacheClusterEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a cache cluster is enabled for the stage. To activate a method-level cache, set CachingEnabled to true for a method.

nested_items.name: cacheClusterSize
nested_items.description: The stage's cache capacity in GB. For more information about choosing a cache size, see Enabling API caching to enhance responsiveness.

nested_items.name: cacheClusterStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the cache cluster for the stage, if enabled.

nested_items.name: methodSettings
nested_items.description: A map that defines the method settings for a Stage resource. Keys (designated as /{method_setting_key below) are method paths defined as {resource_path}/{http_method} for an individual method override, or /\*/\* for overriding all methods in the stage.

nested_items.name: metricsEnabled
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: metricsEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether Amazon CloudWatch metrics are enabled for this method.

nested_items.name: loggingLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies the logging level for this method, which affects the log entries pushed to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Valid values are OFF, ERROR, and INFO. Choose ERROR to write only error-level entries to CloudWatch Logs, or choose INFO to include all ERROR events as well as extra informational events.

nested_items.name: dataTraceEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether data trace logging is enabled for this method, which affects the log entries pushed to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This can be useful to troubleshoot APIs, but can result in logging sensitive data. We recommend that you don't enable this option for production APIs.

nested_items.name: throttlingBurstLimit
nested_items.description: Specifies the throttling burst limit.

nested_items.name: throttlingRateLimit
nested_items.description: Specifies the throttling rate limit.

nested_items.name: cachingEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether responses should be cached and returned for requests. A cache cluster must be enabled on the stage for responses to be cached.

nested_items.name: cacheTtlInSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the time to live (TTL), in seconds, for cached responses. The higher the TTL, the longer the response will be cached.

nested_items.name: cacheDataEncrypted
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the cached responses are encrypted.

nested_items.name: requireAuthorizationForCacheControl
nested_items.description: Specifies whether authorization is required for a cache invalidation request.

nested_items.name: unauthorizedCacheControlHeaderStrategy
nested_items.description: Specifies how to handle unauthorized requests for cache invalidation.

nested_items.name: variables
nested_items.description: A map that defines the stage variables for a Stage resource. Variable names can have alphanumeric and underscore characters, and the values must match [A-Za-z0-9-._~:/?#&=,]+.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: documentationVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the associated API documentation.

nested_items.name: accessLogSettings
nested_items.description: Settings for logging access in this stage.

nested_items.name: format
nested_items.description: A single line format of the access logs of data, as specified by selected $context variables. The format must include at least $context.requestId.

nested_items.name: destinationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch Logs log group or Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream to receive access logs. If you specify a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream, the stream name must begin with amazon-apigateway-.

nested_items.name: canarySettings
nested_items.description: Settings for the canary deployment in this stage.

nested_items.name: percentTraffic
nested_items.description: The percent (0-100) of traffic diverted to a canary deployment.

nested_items.name: deploymentId
nested_items.description: The ID of the canary deployment.

nested_items.name: stageVariableOverrides
nested_items.description: Stage variables overridden for a canary release deployment, including new stage variables introduced in the canary. These stage variables are represented as a string-to-string map between stage variable names and their values.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: useStageCache
nested_items.description: A Boolean flag to indicate whether the canary deployment uses the stage cache or not.

nested_items.name: tracingEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether active tracing with X-ray is enabled for the Stage.

nested_items.name: webAclArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the WebAcl associated with the Stage.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: createdDate
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the stage was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedDate
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the stage last updated.
